Watershed Development Projects

By Aikya Seva Centre

Watershed management is vital for conserving water resources, preventing soil erosion, and improving water availability for agriculture and communities. It ensures sustainable water use, boosts agricultural productivity, and enhances the resilience of ecosystems.

Devdara Talav

Devdara lake was deepened approximately 11 meters to serve as a perennial water source for irrigation and drinking. This lake is a symbol of community-driven conservation.

Devdara Talav filled after monsoon – revitalizing the ecosystem

Watershed Techniques Applied

Deep Continuous Contour Trenches (CCT)

Deep CCTs reduce surface runoff and allow water to percolate slowly, improving groundwater recharge.

Nala Deepening

Nala beds were deepened to store monsoon water and prevent erosion. Shown below: before & after shots.

Nala before (left) and after monsoon (right) – impact made visible

WAT – Water Absorption Trenches

WATs are shallow trenches that slow down water flow and promote percolation on sloped terrain.

Farm Bunding

Farm bunds were constructed along contour lines to reduce soil loss and store moisture in farmland.

Stone Gully Plug

Constructed across small gullies, these plugs prevent erosion and trap silt and water.

Stone Outlets

These provide safe drainage for overflow from bunds and trenches, preventing structural damage.

Shivtalav – Panoli

Shivtalav percolation tank – excavated to improve summer water retention capacity

Watershed development brings resilience, greenery, and livelihood

Celebrating community-led conservation in Maharashtra’s heartland

Impact Summary

  • Over 10 structures deepened, capturing thousands of litres of water
  • Groundwater levels rose in 5+ villages
  • Local crops survived dry months without borewells
  • through these projects villagers engaged in bliss, nirvana, elatedness...

Watershed projects aren’t just about digging trenches — they’re about reshaping rural livelihoods, empowering sustainability, and ensuring water security for generations.
